	And it was rumoured that during that December time they were going to attack leaders of the community.  Now we had to stand together to protect the community.
Then what did you do as the community then?
As the community, we left, we searched for members of the SDU, we did not find some of them until we arrived at Blanko.
Now, when you say as the community, do you mean members of the ANC Youth League were involved also and other people of the community other than ANC Youth League?
The members of the community and members of the ANC Youth League.
Now, you arrived at Blanko's place, what happened?

When we arrived there, he was sleeping because he opened the door and he said, what is happening.  Now the answer we gave him was, you guys caused trouble and thereafter you go to bed.  We want you to tell us where some of your members are, because even the guns that you use against the community, were bought by the same community.
Was Blanko attacked by the community?
What about the ANC Youth League?
I said they were part of the community, so they attacked.
Now after the attack, where did you go?
We went to the long grass and we laid there.
Yes, and after that what happened?

After quite some time, one of us said guys, the members of the SDU are coming.  Then we took different directions, trying to run for cover because they were already shooting.
	We took different directions.
We did not hit back.  They were unexpected sir.
Then describe what happened when they arrived.

There were many of us, even members of the community.  Now, at a place where we thought we were hidden, we were there for a few minutes.  I think just after five minutes, gun shots were heard and we said they are very close, let's run away.
	We then ran to Block A.  There is a house where we got into.  I think we were six if not seven in number.  We stayed there.  The first two went out to check outside for, they were quiet, they didn't come back and myself and the deceased Ali Zulu went out.
	We saw members of the SDU coming, they were armed and...
Now just there, can you describe who exactly did you see?
Who are you referring to sir, members of the SDU?
Yes, can you tell who were they, these members of the SDU?

Yes, I have them.  Nxeba was among them, Oscar was there, Rooivalk was also there, some of them I do not remember because the one mentioned earlier on as Wehna was also there.
	I said to the deceased don't run away, and I grabbed him by his hand, but fear overcame him and he ran away.  He tried to jump over the fence behind where we were sleeping, but he could not jump, and then he fell.  Because they were on his tail, Nxeba himself had a spear and he stabbed him on the cheek with that spear.
	Now he was crying, blood was spitting, Nxeba lifted him up.  Among the members of the SDU who were approaching was Nxeba and then on the 5th, we had an altercation with Nxeba because of a site they wanted to give to someone, and he said I knew that I will catch up with you.
Will you please speak very slowly so that the interpreters may have time to interpret what you are saying.

Thank you sir.  I said when we went out, we saw the members of the SDU and I grabbed the deceased by his hand and I said please, don't try to run away, I know them, they cannot speak with people, all they do is just fight.
	But because fear overcame him, he ran away and he wanted to jump over the fence, he couldn't, he fell.  Nxeba arrived and he stabbed him on the cheek with a spear, then blood came out and then he lifted him and he came back with him.
	There was another group of men coming.  I already told you that on Sunday the 5th, I had an altercation with Wehna and he said I knew that I will catch you, because I told you that this week will not even pass.

I was talking with Oscar and next to him, the others tried to shoot at me.  The one who had 765, tried to shoot me three times, but the magazine went out.
	Rooivalk tried to shoot me with an AK47, it stuck.  Oscar himself shot at the deceased on the chest with six bullets, and then he spit on the floor.
Was there any shootout between you and the SDU's then?
No sir.  There was no shooting out.
Now after Ali was shot at, what happened?

When Nxeba realised that I was not shot at, one could see that he was sweating.  He said guys, you must know that he is their leader, if you kill him, the community is going to ask why did he not come to account.
What happened, what did they do with you?

My Lord, we walked through the township and just before Block D, I think we passed about three shacks, they knocked at a certain shack.  They were already kicking and one boy came out of the shack, I think he was naked, he didn't have clothes on.
	Nxeba stabbed him then they put him back, so that he can put on his clothes.  Then the other one came out.
Do you know who the boy was?
Because of the commotion I cannot, but I do not know him, but I can identify him if he appears today.
At what part of the body was he stabbed?
He was naked, Nxeba stabbed him on the hands and on the ribs, he tried to block with his hands.
Then what happened?  What became of the boy?

I said there was an Albino boy inside the house, when he came out of the house, they said no, he cannot see at night, go back, we don't know what you want here.
	Then we walked along that street and they went into another house to fetch another boy.
Now, when you  went along, was this boy who was stabbed, taken along?
Okay, he went along then, where to?

They tried to round us up.  They managed to catch up with another one, they came with him.
	Because some of them are guarding you and then some get into the shacks, looking for other boys.

I remember one boy was taken out of the house and he was already crying.  Oscar spoke to him and then he asked me whether I know him, and I said no.  You can ask him, verify it with him, he does not know me at all.  It is my first time to see him.
Why did Oscar ask if the boy knows you, do you know?
I think that boy was already crying when he came out, he said he arrived the previous night from Kumalo, he knew nothing of what was happening and Oscar left him and then he said he must leave.
So you went along, where to?
We went to Block F, where Bulelwa's corpse was.  I think there were already three if not two young boys who were captured.  Nxeba, but I do not remember whether it was him, but he is present here.
When you proceeded to Block F, how many of you had been captured by Nxeba and oscer's group?
We were three or four, I can't remember well.
Can you still recall who were with you?
Well, I do not know his name, but he is present.
Could you point him out, let him rise or stand up?
I do not remember the other one, but he is also present here.
I am trying to look for him.  There.
I do not remember the other one.  We were three or four, I do not remember.
You don't remember the names of the other person, or you don't remember whether they were present?
I do not know the name.
The name of the third person?
On your arrival at Block F, what happened?

As I said, when we arrived at Block F, they said to me, I should go to the shack.  I went to the shack again and I went back again to them to the SDU's, and they were together with the members of the community.
Now, you said when you went into the shack, there were already some who were inside the shack, how many were there?
There were seven of you at that stage?
Yes, we were seven.  Those I came with, they proceeded to the shack, then I remained behind.
Can you tell who those who were already in the shack, were, their names?
Those who were already in the shack, some of them have since died.  I don't know the names. They knew me as the leader of the community, but I didn't know some of their names.
Now you were allowed to leave the shack and to go to some people around Bulelwa's body, then what happened?
Were you allowed to go there, or were you instructed to go where Bulelwa's body was?
They did not instruct me, I myself went there.
Were you free to move around?

Yes, I was free because whilst we were still at Bulelwa's corpse, among the community there was one who said what time was it, but at that time it was already sunrise.
	Then somebody said if the Police come, we are going to fight with them because it has already been eight hours since she has died.  From those members of the SDU, that is Vusi, Nxeba and Oscar and Alex, I don't remember the fifth one.
	That is where Oscar, when I returned to the shack, he tried to shoot me, and Mr Mokoena prevented him to do so.
From where the members of the SDU find you up to the spot where Bulelwa's body was, were you just walking freely?
That is correct sir, I was walking freely.
Could you have gone home if you wanted to?
I wouldn't try to go home, because the way they were armed, they would kill me.  But I just said to myself, let me just go like some of those who were captured.
Did they order you to go with them to the spot where Bulelwa's body had been found?
So you were not walking freely then?
It was like that that I was not walking freely, but that is where Nxeba said he was holding me with his hand.  I was walking freely like any other person who was walking with him.
Were you being held by Nxeba?
No sir, he didn't hold me with his hand.
Then what did you do, what happened?
You were at the stage when you were telling us that once at the shack, Oscar tried to shoot at you.  Did he succeed in shooting you?
No sir, he did not succeed because Mr Mokoena prevented him.

He had an AK47, he pulled that AK47 to, as if he was shooting me, then Mr Mokoena pushed him aside and prevented him.  Then Oscar turned to me and said Whena and Tusang are your friends.  If you say I myself have killed Bulelwa, I am going to shoot all of you and go to prison.  That is Oscar.
Whena and Tusang, you Tusaneng and your friends, I am going to shoot all of you and go to prison.
Was that because you were alleging that he had shot Bulelwa?
No, I heard that for the first time from him.
Did he give as a reason for shooting you, the fact that you had said that he had shot Bulelwa?

That is correct.  As I said that among the community there was one who mentioned time, although I don't remember what time he said it was.  Then he said when the Police arrive, we are going to fight them because the deceased has been killed for a long time.
	I have already mentioned those who were in front of me, as to whether are you not going to call the Police, because as a leader of the community, I would say that as we are here.

Would you tell the Committee, from the time when Oscar said he was going to shoot you until when you left the place, what happened, how did you happen to leave the place?  You told us that Oscar tried to shoot you, but Mokoena intervened, then Oscar said to you he was going to shoot all of you, because you are saying that he had killed Bulelwa.
If we say, if we allege that he killed Bulelwa, he will shoot at us.
Yes, now what happened thereafter, after he had said that, what happened?

I already said that among the members of the community, one person mentioned time and it came to my mind that when the Police arrive here, we are going to be at loggerheads with them about the long time that the deceased spent there.
	I already told you the members of the SDU that were around me, now when they responded, let me start with Oscar, he said you know that I came back from prison on Thursday.  Now the Police might take me in again.  Nxeba responded by saying you know that the Internal Stability is looking for me.  Vusi also added, he said guys, you know that all members of the Internal Stability Unit have my name, Alex withdrew, he did not respond.
	I said to them guys, if there is any one among the members of the community who has transport, please provided us with transport so that we can go and fetch the Police because we wanted to go to the hospital, that is how I escaped.
Yes.  Is there any cross-examination Mr Madasa?
Who did you discuss with the question of getting transport?
I discussed this with members of the SDU and members of the community were present, listening at that time.
The members of the SDU that you discussed that matter with, would that include Oscar?
He is not present here among the applicants.
What did they say to this idea of you going to get a car?

They withdrew because I indicated earlier on that we wanted to go and get the Police.  Oscar said no, and he had just been released on Thursday.  Vusi confessed that guys you know my name is among the members of the Stability Unit.  Nxeba said the same.  Alex did not respond, he just stood back.
	The fifth one, who was next to me, I cannot remember him.
Did they allow you to go and look for the motor vehicle?
Didn't they try to prevent you in any manner whatsoever?
One member from the community volunteered that he will provide us with a car to accompany us.
Did that member say that in the presence of Oscar, Vusi, Mike and Alex?
So did you then go along with this member of the community to go and get the car?
Yes, Chairperson, we were three because I do not know the third one.
It was yourself, the owner of the motor vehicle and the third person?
You don't know the name of the owner of the motor vehicle, do you?
I do not remember him, because we did not introduce each other.
Was there any argument as to whether or not you should be put into a shack?
That is correct, there was such an argument.
Who said you should not be put into a shack?
What was the reason MRanced for not putting you in a shack?
That I should go and account before the community, as to what exactly happened, because I was the community leader.
Thank you Mr Chairman.  Did you make a statement to the Police about this matter?
Yes, I arrived at JOCC and I only reported that there was a corpse at Muleleki Extension 2.
My question is have you made a statement to the Police about this matter?
The one you spoke about, about the killings, about you being captured by the SDU?
I did not give them the statement.
Were you approached by the Police to make a statement?
When did you arrive at Muleleki?
I arrived in Muleleki on the 1st of February 1993.
When you arrived, how many Blocks were there?
It was only three Blocks, the fourth one was not yet fully occupied.
Can you name those Blocks, which were originally ...
Block A, B and C.  I mentioned already that D was not yet fully occupied.
Now, when you arrived there, was the SDU already in existence?
In your main statement, evidence in chief, you said the SDU was formed in May or June 1993, now you say in February it was already in existence?
The SDU was formed in May, the one that existed that time was the one formed by the Youth.
So the SDU that existed when you arrived at Muleleki when there were three Blocks, A, B and C and D not fully occupied, was the one that was formed by the Youth, are we understanding you to say that?
Was there another SDU formed, that is now the one that was formed in May.  Who formed that one?
I do not have a full knowledge, but (indistinct) is the first person I knew.
Do you know how it was formed?
I do not know how it was formed, I only heard that there was a newly formed SDU.
The applicants say the SDU was formed in 1992, what do you say about that?
When the SDU was formed in May, June 1993, was a meeting called?
No, we only knew that there was an SDU, we saw them patrolling.
And you later joined them and became one organisation?
Why did you join the new formation instead of joining Youth?
It is because the old one was only members of the Youth, we wanted to join them because they were elderly people, we wanted them to show us the way.
You wanted them to teach you discipline?
We wanted them to show us the way, maybe as the Youth we were not walking the right way.  We wanted them to teach us exactly how the SDU operates.
You wanted them to teach you discipline when patrolling?
Not that we lacked discipline, we did not have the knowledge.
You have admitted that you wanted them to teach you discipline.
Discipline and knowledge, yes.  Because we believed as the Youth we would be telling ourselves that we were doing the right thing, and would have been mistaken.
So you had knowledge, but no discipline?
Mr Madasa, does it follow necessarily that because they wanted discipline, therefore they were not disciplined?
Mr Chairman, the witness has said ...
The witness has said they wanted the SDU because they were old, to teach them discipline because all that they had was knowledge, so I am asking now ...

No, he said, the witness said we wanted to join them because they were adults.  The essence of what he is saying is we wanted to learn from them, how to do things.
	What is being put to you is that you did not have discipline so that is why you wanted to be taught discipline?
That is not correct, it doesn't mean that we did not have discipline.  We wanted a broad knowledge.

Mr Chairman, the witness has said, I asked him specifically and his answer is that they wanted SDU to teach them discipline.  I used the discipline and he used the word discipline, now I am pursuing that.
Mr Madasa, the witness has just answered you and he said they had - he disputes the fact that they did not have discipline.
Are you contradicting yourself, because earlier on you said that you wanted to be taught discipline, now you say you had discipline?  Are you contradicting yourself?
The witness is not contradicting himself here.  The witness simply said we wanted knowledge and discipline and he denies that they did not have discipline, and he disputes that fact.
Mr Chairman, the witness said they wanted knowledge and discipline.
Mr Madasa, the witness, if you want to take the matter up, we can take the matter up in argument.
Did they teach you anything when you joined them?
No, they did not teach us anything because what we saw from them was the harassment of the community.
Did you have arms of your own?
At that time we had arms, but not many.   I think only two.
When you say that time, when was that?
A explained that the SDU was formed in May.  From February until that time in May because as members of the Youth, we were afraid to go to our parents to ask for money to buy arms.
Where did you get the arms from?
Some of our members who resided in the old township, gave us those arms.  They said because you are new, something might happen.  Now you must at least have something to protect yourselves with.
Where did you get the arms from?

I told you Chair, that Muleleki was a new area.  Old townships where we came from, people provided us with guns.  For instance Zone 3, those people provided us with guns.
	They did not give us, they borrowed us so that at the time when we have ours, we would take back theirs.
I asked you a short question, you are giving me a long explanation.  Did you get these guns from Zone 3?

Mr Madasa, how many times do you want the witness to repeat one and the same question?  He has made it clear that they got those guns from the old township in Zone 3, in fact they were loaned to them.
What type of guns were they?
Who was the custodian of those?
There was no one person who would take custody of those guns, they rotated.
Where did you get ammunition from?
When we wanted ammunition, we had to go back to the old township to ask for assistance.
Were all the members of the Youth League at that time eligible to use the firearms?
Yes, they were eligible to use those guns according to the situation that existed in Kathlehong.
The people who were given the arms, were above 16 years of age.
When I asked you, why did you not say only those who were above 16?
When I asked you if you were eligible to carry the guns, you said all, why did you not say only those who were above 16?
Maybe I did not catch your question well.
Yes Chairperson, we were under area 5 at that time.
Who were the members of the Executive?
Tulani, I do not know his surname.
What was he in the Executive, Tulani?
He was the General Secretary of the Section.
I do not know his surname Chairperson, but he is present here.
Can you point him out to us please?
Maya.  Maya is my surname sir.
He was the Secretary for the religious affairs.
I do not remember the others.
Were you part of the Executive?
I became part of the Executive thereafter.  If I am right, it might be September or October.
I told you already that it might have been September or October, I do not have certainty to the dates because I lost some of my documents.
You said you became the Publicity Secretary in September or October.
I am asking the Executive as a whole, because you joined later in the Executive, when was it formed?
The whole Executive was formed in March, towards the end of March.
Why did you not become part?
I did not have interest at that time to be part.  I was satisfied as a person who was MRising them.
Were you ever the Secretary General of the area?
When you were member of SANCO, did you also become a member of the ANC Youth League at the same time?
But in your evidence in chief, right at the beginning, you said no ANC Youth member was part of the Civic?

I said maybe we did not understand each other, I said because the Civic was the umbrella, everybody in the township submitted to the Civic.  I would not refuse when people elect me to that position, because of what I was doing.
Were you elected to the position of ANC Youth League, even though you were part of the Civic?
Then why did you say no member of ANC Youth League was part of the Civic, if you are in fact so?
Sorry Mr Madasa, he did say in the follow up question immediately, that he was a member of both.  He was a member of both the Civic and the ANC Youth League.
Thank you Mr Chair.  Did you know Ndondolo?
Not that much because we were not politically cooperative.
Yes, I knew him as the Commander of Zone 5 then.
Do you recall when Mnyala called a stay away?
Did you support that stay away?
I did not support that stay away as a member of the Civic, because I knew that they had no mandate of calling a stay away without reporting to us.
I do not remember the date very well, but I remember it was on Monday morning when people prepared to ...
It would be difficult to know Chairperson, I do not remember the month, but I know the same year, 1993.
When Mnyala called the stay away, was the ANC Youth League still part of the SDU?
At that time there was no peace.
Between the SDU and the Youth League?
Did you have a quarrel with Mnyala as a result of your disapproval of the stay away?
My instructions are that that was the initial reason why you led ANC Youth League away from the SDU?
Sir, all the people you are applying for, are liars.  They are not telling the bad things they did to the community.
My instructions are that it was as a result of your disapproval of the call for stay away that you led ANC Youth League away from SDU?  Is that so?
They are not telling the wrongs they did to the community.  I have a statement why there was a conflict between us.
Please confine yourself to answering the question, asked.  We will make much more progress in that respect.
What is the answer to the question?
Yes, there was a quarrel between myself and Mnyala because of that stay away.
The question is did you as a result of that quarrel, lead ANC Youth League away from the SDU?
At that time, they had already separated.  I did not lead them away, they had already separated.
To which organisation did he belong?
He was a member of the South African Communist Party and he was also a member of the ANC.
You know the day we sat together, discussing politics of the country, then.
How did you know that he had membership of the Communist Party of South Africa?
I saw his card, he showed me his card.
As an inhabitant, he was my friend.
Were you working close at organisational level, hence you discussed politics?
When you met him at Bulelwa's corpse, before he spoke to you, did you know who had killed Bulelwa?
I did not have knowledge as to who killed Bulelwa.
Mr Madasa, are you still going to be long?

Very well.  At this stage, we will adjourn until Monday at ten o'clock.
COMMISSION ADJOURNS
